intro: Gomesa eleutherosepala, commonly known as the slender gomesa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
